thread.title: Chris Rock to host ABC's Oscar broadcast next year

author: SANDY COHEN
title: Chris Rock to host ABC's Oscar broadcast next year
text:
Mark J. Terrill Producers: Chris Rock brings talent, truth to Oscar telecast 
FILE - In this Feb. 27, 2005 file photo, Chris Rock hosts the 77th Academy Awards telecast in Los Angeles. Rock will return to host the Oscars for a second time. The show’s producers say the prolific comedian-filmmaker will be at the helm for the 88th Academy Awards next February 28. (AP Photo/Mark J. Terrill) Mark J. Terrill Producers: Chris Rock brings talent, truth to Oscar telecast 
FILE - In this Feb. 27, 2005 file photo, Chris Rock hosts the 77th Academy Awards telecast in Los Angeles. Rock will return to host the Oscars for a second time. The show’s producers say the prolific comedian-filmmaker will be at the helm for the 88th Academy Awards next February 28. (AP Photo/Mark J. Terrill, File) Charles Sykes Producers: Chris Rock brings talent, truth to Oscar telecast 
FILE - In this Feb. 28, 2015 file photo, comedian Chris Rock performs at Comedy Central's "Night of Too Many Stars: America Comes Together for Autism Programs" in New York. Rock will return to host the Oscars for a second time. The show’s producers say the prolific comedian-filmmaker will be at the helm for the 88th Academy Awards next February 28. He first hosted the awards ceremony in 2005. (Photo by Charles Sykes/Invision/AP, File) Rob Latour Producers: Chris Rock brings talent, truth to Oscar telecast 
FILE - In this Jan. 4, 2015 file photo, comedian Chris Rock arrives at Variety’s 10 Directors to Watch and Creative Impact Awards in Palm Springs, Calif. Rock will return to host the Oscars for a second time. The show’s producers say the prolific comedian-filmmaker will be at the helm for the 88th Academy Awards next February 28. He first hosted the awards ceremony in 2005. (Photo by Rob Latour/Invision/AP, File) Posted: Wednesday, October 21, 2015 1:26 pm | Updated: 9:02 pm, Wed Oct 21, 2015. Chris Rock to host ABC's Oscar broadcast next year Associated Press | 
LOS ANGELES (AP) — Chris Rock is coming back to host the Oscars for a second time. 
The show's producers say the prolific comedian-filmmaker will be at the helm for the 88th Academy Awards on Feb. 28 at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles. Producers David Hill and Reginald Hudlin called Rock "the MVP of the entertainment industry." Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety.
